intro: Primula laeta, commonly known as the happy primrose, is a perennial flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Asia. It belongs to the Primulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that come in a variety of colors, including white, yellow, and pink. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and features broad, heart-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy texture. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in woodland or alpine habitats. The flowers bloom in early spring, adding a vibrant touch to its natural surroundings.
